lines: You slowly come to on a slate bed. Your brain feels like its burning, and your chest thunders with fast beats like a steam-chisel. Your last recollection is falling  into a bottomless chasm. Who are you?
That is a story for another day... who are you?

You only remember your name, %s. Your attempts to recall more of your past only bring the fever in your mind back to your attention. Shifting slightly over the stone bed, you feel the sticky dampness of blood in your clothes, and recognise the smell of copper and smoke.
You slowly draw your attention inward, using your will to focus past the pain and assess your body.

branches.prompt: It takes little effort, I’ve always been resiliant. I feel fine.
The strong thumping of my hearts is no trouble, my engine throttles faster than most.
My body feels like a great, Brassteel machine. I know I’m stronger than this.
Nothing appears out of the ordinary.

lines: You also notice the pain localised in your chest is likely fractures in your rib-plates [Gain status: Wounded Torso]. It may be immensly painful, but you don’t feel faint or nauseous. Your mind drifts back to your current situation.

branches.prompt: I see a stump where my right arm was. Sudden pain radiates from where my forearm would be, beyond the bloodied bandages.
When I bring my hand to my face, I feel Brassteel where my jaw should be. The sensation of hinges, springs, rods and welded plates below my eyes are impossible to ignore now.
My back must have been destroyed in the fall, now an exoskelleton fused to my spine supports my body. The design is not known to me, and the material seems exotic. Can I rely on this to live?
